info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 3 at 7:14PM CDT until April 3 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Memphis TN
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas, including the following counties, Clay and Greene and Southeast Missouri, including the following county, Dunklin.
* WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 714 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Malden, Piggott, Corning, Campbell, Rector, Marmaduke, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Clarkton, Oak Grove Heights, Holcomb, Lafe, Knobel, St. Francis, Pollard, Greenway, McDougal, Success, Peach Orchard, Delaplaine and Datto. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Rapid onset flooding will result in quick water rises across the affected area. Seek higher ground now.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Clay, AR; Greene, AR; Dunklin, MO
